docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Tuesday, Feb. 18. -- A revolutionary movement in Paraguay, backed by soldiers who defeated Bolivia in the Chaco war, has apparently succeeded.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Tuesday, Feb. 18. -- A revolutionary movement in Paraguay, backed by soldiers who defeated Bolivia in the Chaco war, has apparently succeeded.
docs.abstract: army rebels revolt in Paraguay, angered over results of war

headline.main: ARMY REBELS SEIZE PARAGUAY CAPITAL IN HARD FIGHTING; Troops, Angered Over Results of Chaco War, Rise Against the Ayala Government. PRESIDENT IS HOLDING OUT Asuncion Is Isolated All Day -- Rebels Look to Franco, War Hero, as Leader. ARMY REBELS SEIZE PARAGUAY CAPITAL

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE.Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Wednesday, Feb. 19. -- President Eusebio Ayala of Paraguay handed his resignation to the leaders of the revolution shortly before Monday midnight, according to messages received here yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Wednesday, Feb. 19. -- President Eusebio Ayala of Paraguay handed his resignation to the leaders of the revolution shortly before Monday midnight, according to messages received here yesterday.

headline.main: PARAGUAY REVOLT FORCES AYALA OUT; Rebel Leaders Seem to Be at Odds -- Franco Expected to Fly to Asuncion Today. CABINET REPORTED HELD Public Buildings Bombarded in Four-Hour Battle -- Fears Arise for Chaco Peace.

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITEWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Colonel Rafael Franco, who is to lead the new Paraguayan regime, was the chief Paraguayan commander in the war in the Chaco with Bolivia and won several important strategic victories that undoubtedly hastened the end of the fighting.
docs.lead_paragraph: Colonel Rafael Franco, who is to lead the new Paraguayan regime, was the chief Paraguayan commander in the war in the Chaco with Bolivia and won several important strategic victories that undoubtedly hastened the end of the fighting.
docs.abstract: Paraguayan revolt causes fears for peace

headline.main: FRANCO'S STRATEGY SPEEDED WAR'S END; In the Chaco New Paraguayan Leader Hewed Way Through Jungle and Trapped Foe. AYALA A FORMER TEACHER Deposed President Has Headed Government Twice -- He Was an Envoy to This Country.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19. -- Secretary and Mrs. Cordell Hull gave a "diplomatic dinner" tonight at the Carlton Hotel, entertaining a company which included Ambassadors, Ministers and Charges d'Affaires of many nations represented in Washington.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 19. -- Secretary and Mrs. Cordell Hull gave a "diplomatic dinner" tonight at the Carlton Hotel, entertaining a company which included Ambassadors, Ministers and Charges d'Affaires of many nations represented in Washington.

headline.main: PARAGUAY REVOLT PERILS CHACO PACT; Army Still Holds Territory It Gained and Intends to Bar Further Concessions. NO ARBITRATION EXPECTED PEACE DELEGATE

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE.Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: AT this time of year, when the Atlantic seems very cold and gray and when, after one has traveled it, one is confronted by a Europe still under the mantle of Winter and a Mediterranean filled with the alarums of war, South America materializes out of...
docs.lead_paragraph: AT this time of year, when the Atlantic seems very cold and gray and when, after one has traveled it, one is confronted by a Europe still under the mantle of Winter and a Mediterranean filled with the alarums of war, South America materializes out of potential holiday lands with winsome attraction.
docs.abstract: Trips offered; attractions for tourists; illus

headline.main: SOUTH AMERICA DRAWS CLOSER; An Increasing Number of Northerners Are Becoming Familiar With the People and Scenic Beauties of the Continent
FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED FEB. 22, 1936.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Feb. 23. -- The new Paraguayan Government has canceled the credentials of all delegates and attaches at the Chaco Peace Conference, according to today's dispatches from Asuncion.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Feb. 23. -- The new Paraguayan Government has canceled the credentials of all delegates and attaches at the Chaco Peace Conference, according to today's dispatches from Asuncion.
docs.abstract: new Paraguayan govt dismissed delegates to peace conf

headline.main: PARAGUAY RETIRES FROM CHACO TALKS; Delegates to Peace Parley at Buenos Aires Dismissed -- New Group Planned.
